answers.answer: I'm not trying to freak you out, but babies need at least 37 weeks for their organs to fully develope. I think that's why people are asking if you're scared.

Most babies do just fine after 34 weeks tho and just have to stay in nciu for a bit some dont even need that :) but yes i know 37 weeks is full term. Ill be 35 weeks monday so maybe i can keep this baby in alil longer :)
My doctor told me full term is 39weeks

Just take it easy and stay hydrated. I really hope that bun stays in a few more weeks that way she won't have to be in the NICU. But you're right. Most babies do fine when born around 34/35 weeks. Good luck!

My first was born at 31weeks due to extream preeclampsia that popped up out of no where. So my OB did a csection other wise I was going to die and the high risk was gonna let me. What good are u to ur baby dead. She was fully healthy and breathing on her own she just needed to gain two pounds before she could come home. But deff don't rule out a csection cuz it may save ur life. I was just like you. Now I'm on my second baby and all going good there just watching me very close cuz I was extreamly healthy and it came from nowhere the first time. And they said if it keeps going this way I can have him naturally.
Im tryin to keep her in as long as posible but if she comes theres nothin i can do to stop it :p

Babies organs are fully developed by 35 weeks. After that its all about putting on some pounds. Secondly, 37 weeks is considered full term. I had my last at 37 weeks and he was 7 lbs and very healthy. My Dr is considering inducing me at 37 weeks this time.

You're right. She's gonna come when she wants to. But I'm gonna agree with cridge on the whole c-section thing. If the doctor says you need one, then get it. As a matter of fact- if you get induced then you're more likely to need one than if you're not induced. I know that there's probably plenty of women on here that have been induced with no complications but I'm just putting the facts on the table for you. And don't be scared about the c-section. A lot of my friends have had one and most of them prefer it to a vaginal birth.

I will get one if its needed but i really dont want one :p maybe cause of selfish reasons but i dont want that scar on my belly plus recovery is faster with vaginal and i am anemic so im scared ill bleed to much if i get one. But if i have to i will :p but hopefuly she will stay in here alil longer and come on her own :)

I totally understand. When I was 30 weeks my doctor told me my baby was breech and that if she didn't turn by 37 weeks they would schedule a c-section. I was so scared not cuz of the pain or recovery but cuz I knew I would be awake and I would know what they were doing. But after doing some research and talking to my friends I felt way better about it.
I didnt even think about being awake! If they had to do it id make sure they put me under i would NOT want to be awake! That makes it 10x more scarey for me o.o
Oh my gosh! I'm so sorry for saying that, I honestly thought you knew! Maybe they'll put you under. My friend got put under for a c-section because she has really bad panic attacks...
I mean im glad u said somethin cuz i would refuse them touching me awake! Lol

Every baby is different but you're considered term at 37 weeks. My son was born at 33 weeks breathing on his own with fully developed lungs. It is better to keep the baby in as long as possible but like you said if she comes earlier, there isn't much you can do. But even at full term people ask me if I'm scared and in 37 weeks with baby #5. I think sometimes people who haven't had kids of their own don't know what to say so they ask are you scared. Either way you'll do fine. Best of luck.

saramay,  it's very likely you'll have your baby vaginally but if they have to switch gears and decide to do a c-section,  you won't be "put under" because it's so much harder to recover and the meds go to the baby,  and they don't want to have to deal with a very groggy baby who can't breathe on her own at birth.In emergency c-sections,  where they have to get the baby out within a minute or two they'll put you under but that's just because an epidural would take too long.If you have a c section with an epidural,  you won't be able to see anything because they'll put a sheet up  and won't feel anything other than pressure.

My brother was born at 24.5 weeks. Yes he was very ill and needed help to breath etc but he is absolutely fine now at 15. Babies come when they want you can't stop it can you. Just got to deal with things as there thrown at you. X

My sister had a C section and she actually loved it. Haha but I totally get where you're coming from on the whole people asking if you're scared thing. It's like, are they trying to get you to panic?? I wish everyone could be positive and supportive rather than think about all that could go wrong. Of course we should be realistic, but why should we focus on the cons? There's my rant.

question: Im 34 weeks and been showing signs of preterm :p everyone keeps asking if im scared.... like really whats there to be scared about? Its labor.... yea its gunna hurt but so theres nothing to be scared about :p its not like there is something wrong.... even if she comes early more than likely by now she will be fine and able to breath on her own especialy with thoes steroid shots. If not she may have to be in the incubator for acouple days but really theres nothing to be scared about. Im a first time mom and i have no fear and want it natural. Only thing im scared of is csection and i will refuse it, they will induce me if anything... they are not touching me with a knife unless my baby CAN NOT come out. But imma try with every thing i got :) <3
title: why do people keep asking this
